text: District 3 is an electoral district in Malta. It was established in 1921. Its boundaries have changed many times but it currently consists of the localities of Iż-Żejtun, Ħal Għaxaq, Marsaskala and Marsaxlokk. ==Representatives== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Election !colspan=10|Representatives |- !1921 |rowspan=4; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=4|Antonio Dalli (UPM) |rowspan=4; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=2|Charles Sydney Henry (Conservative) |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Filippo Nicolo Buttigieg (UPM) |rowspan=2; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Michel Borg (UPM) | style="background-color:#FFFFFF" rowspan=4 colspan=2| 4 seats 1921–1935 |- !1924 |rowspan=2; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Giuseppe Mifsud Ellul (Labour) |rowspan=1|Fortunato Ellul (UPM) |- !1927 |rowspan=2|Robert Bencini (Conservative) |rowspan=1|Enrico Sacco (Labour) |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Achille Samut (Conservative) |- !1932 |rowspan=1; style="background-color: " | |rowspan=1|Federico F.
